result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose L Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose L Ortiz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 4 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 2 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with the victim named in the complaint.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by 01/04/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Jose L Ortiz in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, Count 2 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 1:
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Jose L Ortiz in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conferenece.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose L Ortiz in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests more time to review case and to officially be retained.  Co-actor currently in warrant status.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 pm.
Defendant advised that previously ordered No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Jose L Ortiz in court.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court along with 15CF1277.  Defendant informs the court that he has not obtained counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling conference to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
$200.00 bail to be returned.  Status conference scheduled for 04-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jose L Ortiz
Current: 2521 South 33rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 03-25-2015)
Prior: 2521 South 33rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Notte Night Lounge located at 1033 N. Old World Third Street and Cecil M. or the residence or place of employment
Defendant stated he did not want a Public Defender at this time

Defendant Jose L Ortiz in court.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Status Conference in Br.PE.vb
